replies.body:
I once had Up&Go for breakfast for 8 months straight. Every single day.

I do not recommend.

I had rice for breakfast for 10 years straight.

Must've been because i'm Asian.
What happened on the 11th year? Did you become a different ethnicity?
I started preparing the "Aussie" breakfast myself.

> [{quoted}](name=Tomblade,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=pHxnfGer,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-02-16T04:07:29.609+0000)
>
> I once had Up&Go for breakfast for 8 months straight. Every single day.
> 
> I do not recommend.

Eh Up&Go is pretty horrible, I mean the taste is alright but you come out thirstier then before you started drinking it which is why I stopped drinking them.
Why are you guys still replying? gtfo of my house. Also, I pee'd a little.
I never really liked chocolate, also is it weird I usually eat breakfast at like 1-2 in the afternoon.

How can you not like chocolate? Or are you one of those poor sods who are lactose intolerant?

Also it's not weird, I do that too. Mind you I refer to it as 'lunch' but still.

> [{quoted}](name=HeartVine,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=pHxnfGer,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-02-17T05:17:11.713+0000)
>
> How can you not like chocolate? Or are you one of those poor sods who are lactose intolerant?
> 
> Also it's not weird, I do that too. Mind you I refer to it as 'lunch' but still.

I don't dislike it I am just kind of neutral on the matter, years of chocolate binging as a child has left me disliking it as an adult it is just too sweet for me to like it and I hate how it makes my mouth feel. I like sweet drinks and such but sweet food I don't really like much lollies, chocolate, iced cake etc.
I don't have breakfast at all.

Two eggs, two slices of cheese and two slices of bread for breakfast...
%%%% I'm still hungry.
